description: APPLICATION FOR A LAWFUL DEVELOPMENT CERTIFICATE IN RESPECT OF THE PROPOSED ERECTION OF A REAR ROOF EXTENSION INCORPORATING THE INSERTION OF 3 ROOFLIGHTS IN THE FRONT ROOF SLOPE AND ALTERATIONS TO FIRST FLOOR REAR WINDOW.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The operations comprising the erection of a rear roof dormer extension with Juliette balcony would consist of the enlargement of a dwelling house within the meaning of Class B of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development)  (England) Order 2015 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in said Class B. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.

Condition : 2 - The operations comprising the installation of three roof lights in the front roof slope would consist of any other alteration to the roof of the dwelling house within the meaning of Class C of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development)  (England) Order 2015 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in said Class C. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.

Condition : 3 - The operations comprising the replacement of fenestration at the first floor rear of the property would consist of a non-material alteration to the external appearance of the building party wall act within the meaning of Section 55 (2) Town & Country Planning Act 1990 and the (General Permitted Development) (Amendment) (No. 2) (England) Order 2008 "the Order" and would therefore not constitute development as defined in Section 55 (2) and the relevant parts of the Act.

Condition : 4 - The operations comprising the installation of a soil  vent pipe would consist of any other alteration to the dwelling house within the meaning of Class G of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development)  (Amendment) (No. 2) (England) Order 2008 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in said Class G. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.
